key_title: Key to the species of Lemna

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Lemnaceae

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Lemnaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1994). Lemnaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Thallus floating on water surface, elliptic to rounded or broadly obovate, opaque, with stalk indistinct; root single
Thallus suspended below water surface, except when flowering or fruiting, narrowly ovate to narrowly oblong, translucent, narrowed to a distinct stalk; roots absent
Thallus slightly swollen; veins 3–5, all arising from the same point; largest air spaces longer than 0.3 mm
Thallus flat; veins 3, rarely more, but if 4 or 5 then outer veins branching at base of inner ones; air spaces shorter than 0.3 mm
